sentence: *Cum Vulcanus vīdit Venerem cum Marte clam concumbere| catenam ex adamante fecit et circum lectum posuit.*
answer: When Vulcan saw that Venus was sleeping with Mars in secret| he made a chain out of adamant and placed it around the bed. *Vīdit* is indicative.

sentence: *Cum Ulixes videret ingentēs Cyclopēs| vinum eīs dedit.*
answer: When Ulysses saw the giant Cyclopes| he gave them wine. *Videret* is imperfect subjunctive| representing an action contemporaneous with the main clause.

sentence: *Cucurrērunt ad Tauriam| ubi Iphigenia| Orestis soror| fuit sacerdos.*
answer: They ran to Tauria where Iphigenia| the sister of Orestis| was priest. *fuit* is indicative.

sentence: *Cum navem fecisset| femina ad Troiam navigāvit.*
answer: After she had made a ship| the woman sailed to Troy. *Fecisset* is pluperfect subjunctive| representing an action completed prior to the main clause.
